FuncDef:
The timer end-x update-delay command is used to configure the delay for sending the static End.x SID to the FES table.
The undo timer end-x update-delay command is used to restore the default configuration.
By default, the static End.x SID is sent to the FES table immediately.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the delay time for the static End.X SID to delay the delivery of the FES table.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 600000, in milliseconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The timer end-x update-delay command sets the delay for sending the static End.x SID to the FES table. It is mainly used in the scenario where the status of the outbound interface associated with the static End.x SID is changed from Down to Up.
